title: Strengthening Long-Term Memory in Antimicrobial Pharmacology: Active Learning-Based Online Course

context.prior_knowledge: Basic pharmacology concepts and understanding of microbiology
context.additional_context: Learners review pre-learning materials through the LMS platform, participate in asynchronous discussions, and engage in active learning tasks. Using personal devices (BYOD), they create and share flower diagrams for collaborative assessment.

learning_goals: Learners can accurately represent the spectrum of action of antimicrobial agents using a flower diagram.
Learners achieve a correct answer rate that is 5% higher than traditional lecture-based education in an assessment test after 10 weeks.
Learners successfully store core concepts of antimicrobial pharmacology in long-term memory through active learning methods.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
